results.title: Squirrel-cage rotor principles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Laws of magnetism and induced electromagnetic fields.; electric flow in squirrel-cage rotor setting up magnetic poles which create torque; construction of squirrel-cage rotors.

results.title: Squinka
results.brief_description: A film about the power a Squinka medallion has over a group of young people and how it becomes a mnemonic for the group as they search for jobs. After some argument they exchange their individual interpretations of what Squinka means. They discuss how Squinka can be used to guide individual careers.

results.title: Squeak the squirrel
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Lester F. Beck
results.brief_description: A baby squirrel is used in experiments to show how animals learn. He soon learns not to be afraid of people, finds how to get nuts out of glass tubes and out of boxes. He stuffs them in his cheek pouches and scurries off to hoard them in his nest.

results.title: Squash Clinic
results.brief_description: Jahangir Khan - world squash champion and his coach Rahmat Khan feature in this comprehensive instructional video on squash technique. The player standard at which the video is aimed commences with beginners, includes the intermediate level and finishes with advanced instruction.

results.title: Squarejohns
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, ONF | NFB and Bill Davies
results.brief_description: Follows the adjustment of two paroled prisoners as observed by their parole officer. One of the men, aging and tired, seems resigned to the “square” life of “the street.” He seems more in need of protection than supervision. The other is younger, more demanding of life and so more tempted. How the parole officer works to aid both through the parole period is convincingly shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Parker, ONF | NFB and Bill Davies

results.title: Square pegs, round holes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Helps young people understand individualism and the pressures of conformity by presenting an animated story about a cube who learns from its disappointments in trying to fit into round holes that being different is just as good as being the same.

results.title: Square pegs
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Today, applying for a job often means submitting to innumerable tests, not only of ability and intelligence, but also of personality. But just how valid are these tests? This program examines some of the techniques used by the boom industry of Management Selection and follows two candidates through their ordeal.

results.title: Spy Trap
results.brief_description: This Australian documentary/drama tells how the defection of Soviet spy Vladmir Petrov in Canberra 1954 led to a political crisis in Australia and the eventual ‘smoking out’ of the century’s master spy, Harold Russell (Kim) Philby - a senior KGB agent for more than fifty years. Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.
results.description: This Australian documentary/drama tells how the defection of Soviet spy Vladmir Petrov in Canberra 1954 led to a political crisis in Australia and the eventual ‘smoking out’ of the century’s master spy, Harold Russell (Kim) Philby - a senior KGB agent for more than fifty years. Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.
description_for_label: This Australian documentary/drama tells how the defection of Soviet spy Vladmir Petrov in Canberra 1954 led to a political crisis in Australia and the eventual ‘smoking out’ of the century’s master spy, Harold Russell (Kim) Philby - a senior KGB agent for more than fifty years. Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.
